extendedIngredients.name: butter
extendedIngredients.originalString: 2 sticks or 1 cup unsalted butter, cold

extendedIngredients.name: cup cake
extendedIngredients.originalString: *Using spoon fill measuring cup with flour until required amount is obtained. (Scooping measuring cup directly into flour bag will firmly pack flour resulting in too much flour required for recipe.)
metaInformation: with flour until required amount is obtained. (scooping measuring cup directly into flour bag will firmly pack flour resulting in too much flour required for recipe.)

extendedIngredients.name: flour
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1/4 cup all-purpose flour (spoon and sweep method*)

extendedIngredients.name: granulated sugar
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tablespoon Imperial Sugar Extra Fine Granulated Sugar

extendedIngredients.name: sweetened coconut
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 cup shredded coconut, sweetened or unsweetened

extendedIngredients.name: redi-measure
extendedIngredients.originalString: 6 pouches Redi-Measure or 1 1/2 cups Imperial Sugar Light Brown Sugar

recipes.title: Butterfinger Treats

winePairing.pairingText: Treat on the menu? Try pairing with Cream Sherry, Moscato d'Asti, and Port. A common wine pairing rule is to make sure your wine is sweeter than your food. Delicate desserts go well with Moscato d'Asti, nutty desserts with cream sherry, and caramel or chocolate desserts pair well with port. One wine you could try is NV Solera Cream Sherry. It has 4.5 out of 5 stars and a bottle costs about 17 dollars.

productMatches.title: NV Solera Cream Sherry
productMatches.description: The Solera Cream Sherry has a brilliant amber and deep copper hue. With butterscotch and pecan aromas, the sweet salted nut and brown spice aromas carry a complex caramel accent. A sweet entry leads to a rounded, lush, moderately full-bodied palate with a lengthy, flavorful finish.

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 375F.For easy removal of baked Butterfinger bars, line a 9 x 13 x 2 inch pan with parchment paper. If no parchment paper is used, butter and flour pan.Cut cold butter in small pieces and rub into first listed flour, sugar and salt until dough forms. If desired, pulse these ingredients in a food processor until dough forms.Press dough evenly onto the bottom of the pan. Dip your fingers into flour if dough is too sticky or place pan in the freezer for several minutes.Place in oven for 13 to 15 minutes or until light golden brown.Meanwhile in a bowl beat eggs and add brown sugar. Whisk well. Add remaining ingredients.Spread filling into hot crust and return to oven for approximately 15 to 20 minutes or until center is firm. Then let cool.If desired, frost with Basic Butter Cream Frosting. Spread frosting on cooled Butterfinger bars and cut into squares.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 375F.For easy removal of baked Butterfinger bars, line a 9 x 13 x 2 inch pan with parchment paper. If no parchment paper is used, butter and flour pan.

Cut cold butter in small pieces and rub into first listed flour, sugar and salt until dough forms. If desired, pulse these ingredients in a food processor until dough forms.Press dough evenly onto the bottom of the pan. Dip your fingers into flour if dough is too sticky or place pan in the freezer for several minutes.
Place in oven for 13 to 15 minutes or until light golden brown.Meanwhile in a bowl beat eggs and add brown sugar.
Spread filling into hot crust and return to oven for approximately 15 to 20 minutes or until center is firm. Then let cool.If desired, frost with Basic Butter Cream Frosting.
Spread frosting on cooled Butterfinger bars and cut into squares.
